post_text:
Union School District Food Services is excited to announce that we are now offering free meals to all students. Meals may be picked up at Dartmouth Middle School between the hours of 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. Monday, Wednesday and Friday.

Please stay in your car and wear a mask or face covering. Staff will come to you.
Walk-up community members may pick up meals from a distribution table.
Meals are available for any student 18 years old and younger.
No paperwork/identification required.
Students do not need to be present.
Pick-up only - no eating at the school.

If you have any questions please reach out to Diane Nunes at (408) 558-4203 or nunesd@unionsd.org.

Pick-up Time:
11:00 A.M. to 1:00 P.M. every Monday, Wednesday and Friday

(No distribution on Monday, September 7, 2020 because of the Labor Day Holiday)

Pick-up Location:
Dartmouth Middle School
5575 Dartmouth Drive

Monday (2 breakfasts and 2 lunches)
Wednesday (2 breakfasts and 2 lunches)
Friday (3 breakfasts and 3 lunches)

post_text:
Our schools have started the year in some of the most unique and challenging circumstances. Through it all, USD teachers, staff and community members have continued to support our students, families and each other. Several members of our USD family are facing hardships due to the devastating wildfires. A fund has been set up with all donations going directly to impacted USD teachers and staff members.

If you would like to donate, click here: https://gf.me/u/yubtbr

Our community is resilient and has always been ready and willing to support each other in times of need. Thank you to all for your patience and understanding as we continue to navigate these uncertain times together, and thank you for everyone‚Äôs unwavering dedication to our schools and our students. #usdlearns

Advocate for USD Schools: Email Your Legislators Today

The California School Boards Association is asking for support from communities, staff and families, in advocating for funding for California school districts.

Visit: https://p2a.co/2VrENJH for an email form to share your input on the funding that will be allocated for districts for the upcoming school year.

"Legislative leaders and the Administration are currently negotiating the final details of the 2020‚Äì21 state budget and your legislators need to hear support for the level of funding they approved in their version of the budget."

post_text:
Union School District hosted our first ever STEAM Nights at each of our elementary schools last spring, and again this past fall. The events have been a huge success, bringing families and educators together to explore STEAM. A huge thank you to our STEAM TOSAs (Teacher on Special Assignment), our staff and teachers at each site, our student volunteers, and parents who shared their STEAM expertise.

#steam #steameducation #education #usdlearns

--

On December 10th, the amazing Union School District STEAM Team (Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, Math Teachers on Special Assignment) presented at a meeting of the Board of Trustees on their work in co-teaching, building integrated curriculum resources, and strengthening community connections. Their work has empowered and engaged our students, families and teachers. Go STEAM Team!

post_text:
Pam Rissmann, teacher at Dartmouth Middle School, has been recognized by Project Lead The Way as a 2018-19 PLTW Outstanding Teacher. Project Lead The Way (PLTW) recognizes exceptional teachers who inspire, engage, and empower their students by creating transformative learning experiences in their classrooms AND BEYOND through PLTW programs. Those selected as PLTW Outstanding Teachers demonstrate leadership within the classroom and school, transform teaching by using innovative methods to engage students in project-based learning, and actively pursue professional and personal development. Pam will be officially recognized at an upcoming PLTW Summit.

We are so proud of Pam and the many accomplishments of her students. This well-deserved recognition highlights her amazing work at Dartmouth. Congratulations Pam!

post_text:
Become a Substitute Teacher

Are you interested in making a difference in the lives of students? Then substitute teaching may be the right job for you! Union School District is seeking kind and compassionate people to join our team of substitute teachers. As a substitute, you can set your own schedule, gain valuable classroom experience, and enjoy a great source of supplemental income. If you would like to learn more about becoming a substitute teacher, please contact Lenette Solis at the District Office (solisl@unionsd.org or 408-377-8010).

post_text:
Board Meeting Highlights - April 11, 2016

Principal Joy Shmueli introduced Alta Vista 4th and 5th grade students, who are members of the Mouse Squad leadership youth development program. The Mouse Squad members strive to improve a school‚Äôs ability to use technology and to help teachers. The students demonstrated their app-enabled Sphero robotic balls and held a spirited ‚ÄúSphero challenge‚Äù with the Board of Trustees and cabinet members.

Dartmouth teachers Cathy Kennedy and Jennifer Austin introduced the DMS students‚Äô presentation topic, ‚ÄúInnovation Project Proposals.‚Äù The teachers presented the students with a challenge to positively impact the Dartmouth community. The first group of students presented the ‚ÄúAnnual Dartmouth Color Run.‚Äù The second group of students presented the ‚ÄúDartmouth Parcourse.‚Äù The goal of both projects is to help the community
live a healthier lifestyle.

Dartmouth teachers Cathy Kennedy and Jennifer Austin introduced the DMS students‚Äô presentation topic, ‚ÄúInnovation Project Proposals.‚Äù The teachers presented the students with a challenge to positively impact the Dartmouth community. The first group of students presented the ‚ÄúAnnual Dartmouth Color Run.‚Äù The second group of students presented the ‚ÄúDartmouth Parcourse.‚Äù The goal of both projects is to help the community

post_text:
February Board Highlights - February 8, 2016

The Board recognized twelve individuals for outstanding awards received. Jeannie Krepelka from Oster was recognized for receiving the Santa Clara County Teacher of the Year award. Dartmouth‚Äôs Dave Hill was recognized for receiving the Silicon Valley Education Foundation
Teacher of the Year award. Cathleen Adelman (Dartmouth) and Mike Barbara (Union) were both recognized for receiving the California League of Middle Schools Educator of the Year award. Manny Nunes from Alta Vista was recognized for receiving the CASBO Facilities Award. Franscisco Sorto (Guadalupe) was recognized for receiving the CASBO Maintenance and Operations award. Dartmouth students Avichai, Jadelyn, Advit, and Jaythan (Guadalupe) won a first place championship award at the First Lego League Robotics Tournament and were also honored. Their mentors, Mr. Dao and Mr. Deepak helped the team to victory and received recognition as well.
Congratulations to all!

Teacher of the Year award. Cathleen Adelman (Dartmouth) and Mike Barbara (Union) were both recognized for receiving the California League of Middle Schools Educator of the Year award. Manny Nunes from Alta Vista was recognized for receiving the CASBO Facilities Award. Franscisco Sorto (Guadalupe) was recognized for receiving the CASBO Maintenance and Operations award. Dartmouth students Avichai, Jadelyn, Advit, and Jaythan (Guadalupe) won a first place championship award at the First Lego League Robotics Tournament and were also honored. Their mentors, Mr. Dao and Mr. Deepak helped the team to victory and received recognition as well.
Congratulations to all!

post_text:
Three Union School District staff members were honored on Friday at the California Association of School Business Officials (CASBO) annual The Magnificent Seven Outstanding School Employees Award ceremony.

Mary Meisenbach was honored for her service to CASBO. Manny Nunes was honored for Facilities. Francisco Sorto was honored for Maintenance and Operations. Each of these amazing employees were recognized for their outstanding support of our school programs.

USD is honored to have such dedicated employees!

post_text:
Congratulations to our 2015 USD Young Authors!

On December 1, 2015, 15 Young Authors from across the district were honored as selected winners of Union School District's Spring 2015 Writer‚Äôs Faire. Proud parents and teachers listened and watched as students presented their works, described the reasons they love to write, and gave commemorations to the people who inspired them most. The award-winning works included essays, personal narratives, fiction and non-fiction books, and poetry.
